The Clinic Stop file (#40.7) contains all AMIS Stop Codes and their associated Name, Restriction Type (E-Either, P-Primary Only, or S-Secondary Only), and if applicable, Restriction Date (for P or S Restriction Types).  If a clinic stop entry is inactive, there is anInactive Date. This file has been "Locked Down" so that Fileman and other user updates are not allowed.  Changes may be made only through VistA Maintenance (VM) patches coordinated with Decision Support Office (DSO) and Enterprise Product Services (EPS). The file definition (data dictionary) shall not bemodified.  All additions, changes, inactivations, and reactivations toentries in the file shall be accomplished only by VM patches.  Creatingnew Stop Codes or local Stop Codes, and/or editing fields in the file, isnot permitted.  The one exception is described as follows: Users may use the Scheduling option SD EDIT LOCAL STOP CODE (which requires SD SUPERVISOR key)  to edit the Name of the "locally defined" Stop Codes which are set aside for local use:  451-456, 458-473, 475-479, and 482-485.

Enter the text that you would like the patient to see in their Recall letter.
This file contains what type of Recall notification should be used. It holds various settings for each entry.
This file will contain all Providers who have been entered into the Recall Reminder application. Entries in this file must be in the New Person file first.
This file contains Recall Reminder Teams, which can be entered for specialty areas or physical location. Entries in the file will be used when setting up a Recall Provider.
This file holds records deleted from the RECALL REMINDERS [#403.5]file, whether deleted by the user or because they were given appointments.

This table contains outpatient related information for a patient.For example, it contains computed fields that indicate the currentprimary care team, positions and practitioner assigned to the patient.
This field will contain a cached version of a patient's PACT and otherteam assignment details that is displayed in the CPRS PCMMR DetailsWindow.

This table contains a history of the teams thathave been assigned to the patient over time.Sites are NOT allowed to edit the structure of this file.  Making any kind of revision to this file may result in a faulty performance of thePrimary Care Management Software or other DHCP software that uses this file.  Updates to this file should only be done as a result of an official patch to the Scheduling Module. Sites are NOT allowed to edit this file's fields via FileMan, without the direction of DHCP Customer Support.  Deleting, changing, or adding entries to this file may result in faulty performance of the Primary Care Management Software or other DHCP software that uses this file.

This file contains a history of positions that have been assignedto the patient.Sites are NOT allowed to edit the structure of this file.  Making any kind of revision to this file may result in a faulty performance of thePrimary Care Management Software or other DHCP software that uses this file.  Updates to this file should only be done as a result of an official patch to the Scheduling Module. Sites are NOT allowed to edit this file's fields via FileMan, without the direction of DHCP Customer Support.  Deleting, changing, or adding entries to this file may result in faulty performance of the Primary Care Management Software or other DHCP software that uses this file.

This is the parameter file for PCMM.  There should be only one entry in thisfile.  The IEN of this entry must be 1.  If other entries are added and thecode not adjusted PCMM will not function properly.  This file should only beupdated or modified with the help of NVS or a PCMM developer.

This file contains the PCMM server patches that have been issued sinceSD*5.3*177. Data in this file will be adjusted by new patches and KIDS builds.This file should not be edited by the site unless specifically instructed bythe CIOFO.

This file contains a list of the PCMM client versions that have come out sinceSD*5.3*177.  Data in this file will be adjusted by new patches and KIDS builds.This file should not be edited by the site unless specifically instructed bythe CIOFO.

This file contains a log of all PCMM HL7 Transmissions that haveoccurred at the medical center.  It is also used to track PCMMHL7 Transmission errors that have been transmitted back to themedical center from the Austin Automation Center (AAC). The data in this file is maintained by the PCMM software moduleand should not be altered.

This table file contains a list of all error codes that the AustinAutomation Center (AAC) will report when processing PCMM HL7Transmissions. This table should not be edited in anyway by the site. If an entry in thisfile needs to be to be added, modified or deleted; a patch will be issuedinstructing the site how to make the change.
Track patients that need their primary care data transmitted to Austin.
The is the full description of this error.
This is a local table file containing the site's names for teams.team. Teams can be setup as primary care teams or service specific teams. Super-teams can be setup as a group of teams.

This table holds the history of which users were assigned to eachTeam Position and when.Sites are NOT allowed to edit the structure of this file.  Making any kind of revision to this file may result in a faulty performance of thePrimary Care Management Software or other DHCP software that uses this file.  Updates to this file should only be done as a result of an official patch to the Scheduling Module. Sites are NOT allowed to edit this file's fields via FileMan, without the direction of DHCP Customer Support.  Deleting, changing, or adding entries to this file may result in faulty performance of the Primary Care Management Software or other DHCP software that uses this file.
Historical changes in FTEE values.This is set by crossreference, should not be edited.

This table holds the history of which preceptor positions were assigned toeach Team Position and when.  Sites are NOT allowed to edit the structureof this file. Making any kind of revision to this file may result in afaulty performance of the Primary Care Management Software or other DHCPsoftware that uses this file. Updates to this file should only be done asa result of an official patch to the Scheduling Module. Sites are NOT allowed to edit this file's fields via FileMan, without thedirection of DHCP Customer Support.  Deleting, changing, or adding entriesto this file may result in faulty performance of the Primary CareManagement Software or other DHCP software that uses this file.

This file tracks patient events of interest to PCMM. For patient death events, the file is updated by the DG FIELD MONITORevent driver executing the SCMC PCMM INACTIVATE ON DATE OF DEATH eventprotocol.
This table contains the practitioner and administrative positions associated with a Team.
Multiple Entry of Associated Clinics. This replaces single value used before patch SD*5.3*297

This file is a logical multiple of the TEAM File (#404.51).  It containsthe history of activations and inactivations for the team.Sites are NOT allowed to edit the structure of this file.  Making any kind of revision to this file may result in a faulty performance of thePrimary Care Management Software or other DHCP software that uses this file.  Updates to this file should only be done as a result of an official patch to the Scheduling Module. Sites are NOT allowed to edit this file's fields via FileMan, without the direction of DHCP Customer Support.  Deleting, changing, or adding entries to this file may result in faulty performance of the Primary Care Management Software or other DHCP software that uses this file.

This is the log file of the statuses of the team positions.  Primarily,this is used to determine if a position is active for a certain timeperiod.Sites are NOT allowed to edit the structure of this file.  Making any kind of revision to this file may result in a faulty performance of thePrimary Care Management Software or other DHCP software that uses this file.  Updates to this file should only be done as a result of an official patch to the Scheduling Module. Sites are NOT allowed to edit this file's fields via FileMan, without the direction of DHCP Customer Support.  Deleting, changing, or adding entries to this file may result in faulty performance of the Primary Care Management Software or other DHCP software that uses this file.

This file contains Stop Codes used by Mental Health to produce reports within PCMM. The following report uses this file to produce output:         MH Encounter Report [SCMC MH PCMM ENCOUNTER RPT] Future updates to this file will be handled through the National Patch Release Module.
This file contains the scheduling parameters.
This multiple keeps track of when a Scheduling file was deleted as part ofACRP Database Conversion (SD*5.3*211). The file, user responsible and thedate/time of deletion are tracked.
This multiple has been added for patch 102.  It contains information foreach encounter date reviewed.

This field is not used after installing SD*5.3*247 because the close out dateswill be calculated.The previous  description:This multiple will contain close out dates of the National Patient CareDatabase (NPCD) for a given month/year that an encounter can occur.

This file contains the definitions for hard coded scheduling reportsthat are available to the user on a client workstation.These definitions are pre-determined and must not be modified unlessexplicitly instructed as part of a patch or module upgrade.The parameters specified in each report definition are used by theclient application. The parameters indicate what prompts are presentedto the user, which prompts are required as part report criteria.Also, where possible, a default value is specified that is usedwhen first displaying the prompt.
This field contains a description of the report's purposeand output.
This multiple field contains the list of possible waysthis report can be sorted.If this list contains more then one entry, then the usermust select a sort as part of the report criteria.
This multiple contains the list of fields used by this reportdefinition.

This multiple contains the list of files that theuser usually must select entries for as part ofthe report criteria.Most reports require at least the selection ofone entry from each file in the multiple.However, there is at least one report where only oneselection is allowed for the file. Also, there is atleast one report that does not require any selection tobe made if the user desires the report to search fornull values.The 'NUMBER OF SELECTIONS REQUIRED' (#.02) fieldindicates how many selections need to be made.

This file contains the field definitions used by the SCHEDULING REPORTDEFINITION (#404.92) file. Including a field in the report definitionmeans that the field is presented to the user as part of the report critieria. This file defines the relationship between the field anda GUI component.These field definitions are pre-determined and must not be modified unlessexplicitly instructed as part of a patch or module upgrade.
This field contains a breif description of the purpose of thefield as it is used in the Query Template Utility.

This file defines specific scheduling report groups. Each reportdefinition in the SCHEDULING REPORT DEFINITION (#404.92) is assoicatedwith a report group.The report group allows the easy display of related report definitionsto the user for selection.These groups are pre-determined and must not be modified unlessexplicitly instructed as part of a patch or module upgrade.

This file stores report criteria specifications used to printreports defined in the SCHEDULING REPORT DEFINITION (#404.92) file. These user-defined templates can then be access by the user, eliminatingthe need to specify the criteria each time a report needs to be executed.The user can created/edit/copy/delete his or her own templates. The usercan also specify whether the template is a 'personal' or'public' template. Personal templates can only be used by the userwho created it. Public templates can be used by anyone but canonly be edited by the template creator. However, another user can copyand edit a public template specification by using the 'Save As...' command.Templates are only available on client workstation.
Personal description for template specified by the template's creator.
This multiple contains the field names and user specifiedvalues needed by the REPORT (#.04).
This multiple contains the list of file entriesselected by the user to meet the report criteriaselection requirements.

This file contains Conversion Specification Templates (CST) thatare used by the ACRP Database Conversion (SD*5.3*137). These templatesallow management of the conversion process to meet the needs of theindividual site. Each template contains the following:      1) Start and End dates for encounters to be converted      2) Event logs (estimate, convert, re-convert)      3) Action logs (schedule, stop, re-start)       4) Error logs      5) Conversion event start/stop parameters      6) Estimate statistics      7) Record creation statisticsThe database conversion logic utilizes and updates the information stored ineach CST.
This sub-file contains the request action log for events executed forthis CST.
This field contains any errors encountered while processing the CST events.
This sub-file contains information about the events which took placefor this CST.
This field contains any comments related to the event.

This file holds the data for all admissions, transfers, discharges,treating specialty changes, and lodger movements.  These entries must notbe edited through fileman.  Instead, the appropriate bed control optionsshould be executed to insure data consistency. The following cross-references exist on this file:                                                                                                                                                                      where:     TT=Transaction type where choices are as follows:                1=admission          4=check-in lodger                2=transfer           5=check-out lodger                3=discharge          6=specialty change            AS=ASIH Sequencewhere choices are as follows:                1=transfer to hospital ASIH                2=Admission to hospital (automatically generated by module)           or  1=discharge from hospitalwithin 30 days of ASIH stay                2=transfer to or discharge from NHCU/DOM (automatically generated by module)           [NOTE:  This value is 0 for non-ASIH movements or ASIH movements where there are not 2 movements at the same date/time]
Enter an in-depth description of the diagnosis for this patient.  This willbe asked for movements with a TRANSACTION TYPE of SPECIALTY TRANSFER only.

This file contains all allowable admission, discharge, transfer,specialty change, check-in lodger, and check-out lodger movements.These are site determined and site maintained.  However, we STRONGLYrecommend that when updating movement types, you utilize the 'EditBed Control Movement Types' option to ensure all data is properlyupdated.

This multiple contains all other movement types which this entry canfollow.  For admissions and check-in lodger movements, this multiplewill be blank as they can not follow anything.  The multiple will nevercontain a discharge or a check-out lodger movement as nothing can followthose movements.  The 'Can Only Follow' syntax relates to one episode,either a lodger stay or an inpatient admission.

This file holds all MAS accepted/approved movement types.  All entries inyou FACILITY MOVEMENT TYPE FILE (file 405.1) must point to an entry in thisfile.  This file is distributed by MAS and should NOT be altered by anyfacility.  Altering this file can severely corrupt the integrity of yourbed control movement options.  The internal entry numbers of this file areused by various packages to determine the processing necessary.  Thesenumbers and entries must remain as distributed by the MAS package.

This multiple contains all other types of movements which this entry isallowed to follow.  For admissions, this multiple will be blank as theycan not follow any other movements.  This is also true for check-in lodgermovements.  This multiple will never contain discharges or check-out lodgermovements as nothing can follow them.  The 'can only follow' syntax holdsonly for a single episode:  either a lodger episode or an admissionepisode. This data is distributed by the MAS software package under the directionand review of MAS VACO as well as the MAS expert panel.  Editing of entriesin this multiple will have severe and extremely negative affects on theoperation of the MAS software package as well as other DHCP softwarepackages.

This file holds all type of movement transactions.  The data in this file isdestributed with the MAS package and must NOT be altered in any way.  Thereare currently 6 entries in this file:                1      ADMISSION                2      TRANSFER                3      DISCHARGE                4      CHECK-IN LODGER                5      CHECK-OUT LODGER                6      SPECIALTY TRANSFER.
This file contains all room-beds found at your site as well as dataabout our-of-service periods for those beds.  This file is maintainedby the site.
Enter the list of wards which can assign this bed.
This multiple contains information on when this bed has been placed out-of-service.

This file contains the VACO-approved reasons a room-bed or ward may beplaced out-of-service.  These entries must not be altered in any way.The internal entry numbers and the entries themselves have been addedunder the direction of MAS VACO and are the only approved reasons forplacing wards and beds out-of-service.  Altering of this data in anyway can have severe and negative impacts on the operations of many DHCPpackages.
This file contains all site-determined descriptions for a room-bed.Examples are 'PRIVATE ROOM', 'NON-SMOKING', etc.  This file ismaintained by the site.
This file holds all site determined reasons why a patient may be lodgedat a facility.

This file contains all letters that may be sent out by a site.  Theseinclude letters notifying patients of future appointments, cancelledappointments, and scheduled admissions.  The site can edit the text thatthey would like to appear in these letters.

The initial section of the letter is the portion that has been pre-\programmed by the developer to include items such as veteran'sname, address, social security number and is in the format of a VA style letter.  The first paragraph automatically lists theclinic and date/time he/she may have or had an appointment in oneof the facility's outpatient areas.

The final section of the letter is a word-processing field in which,through a scheduling menu option, the user can enter the body of theletter with site=specific information or announcements for the veteran.
This file holds the types of letter, e.g. Pre-Appointment, No-Show, etc.The Letter file points to this file.

This file contains the names of the transmission routers or destinationpoints that data will be electronically transmitted to.  It holds thespecific information connected with each router, eg. lines per message.

The mail router is the actual router name/destination that is givento a transmission router for electronic flow of data to usually theAustin DPC.  For example, the mail router used to transmit Fee Basisdata to Austin DPC is named Q-FEE.VA.GOV
This file holds the discretionary workload reports.

This file contains all acceptable relationships for persons contained in thePATIENT RELATION file.  These relationships are provided by MAS VACO for usein the income screening and means test portions of the MAS software.  Theymust NOT be altered in any way at the site level.  No entries may be added,edited, or removed from this file.

This file contains all relations of a veteran, including the veteranhimself/herself.  Demographic data (name, SSN, date of birth, and sex)can be found in either the PATIENT file (if the relation is a veteran)or in the INCOME PERSON file (if the relation is not a veteran).  Asingle individual may be entered in this file more than once of thatindividual is related to more than one veteran.  An example would bea spouse that was a veteran.  One entry would exist for the veteranhimself and one as the husband of his veteran wife.  This would alsohold true for children of two veteran parents. This file relates all relations for a veteran to the veteran.  Theserelations are date sensitive and can be activated and inactivated. Data in this file is utilized by the income screening and means testportions of MAS.  It should be edited through those applications andnot through direct access through VA FileMan.

This multiple contains data on when an individual became a dependent anda non-dependent.  First, a date must be selected and then it must bedetermined whether on that date the relative became active or became anon-dependent.  This information is used in the means test and incomescreening modules for purposes of income collection.  Only those personsthat are active relatives of a patient will require income collection.

This file contains demographic information (name, social security number,date of birth, and sex) for non-veteran relations of patients seen at thisfacility.  This information is collected for use in the means test andincome screening modules of MAS.  This data will also be used forIVM (Income Verification Matching) with the IRS (Internal Revenue Service).
This file contains the individual annual income for a veteranand any applicable relations.  This income information isused in registration and means test.
This file contains the income relation type data for a veteranand any applicable relations.  This relation type information isused in registration and means test.
This file contains the annual financial tests for a veteran.
This field contains comments on the test.
This file contains the statuses associated with the means test.
Enter in this field the description associated with the financial test status.
Enter in this field the effective date of the financial test status.
This file contains the types of test assoicated with financial datacollected.

This file contains a list of the various sources from which an income testmay originate.  This would include the VAMC if the means test wasadministered by a user or IVM if the income was verified by the IncomeVerification Match Center. This file, and the data contained within the file, is strictly maintainedand should not be altered at the site level.  Editing of this file or thedata contained within may result in data corruption or may cause softwareto malfunction.
This field will contain a word processing description of the incomesource.

The MEANS TEST CHANGES file is a file which tracks certain types of actionsto a means test.  Such actions which lead to an entry in this file areadding a means test, edits to a means test, changing a means test category,adjudicating a means test. Entries are automatically added to this file as an event to an actionon a means test. A deletion of a means test will result in the deletion of any changespreviously recorded in this file for the patient and date of meanstest being deleted.

The MEANS TEST CHANGES TYPE file contains the types of changes whichcan be made to a means test.  This is a table file.  The types of changeswithin this file are selectable only if active. The MEANS TEST CHANGES file points to this file.
These are the valid appointment types to be used in Scheduling as determined by the MAS SIUG.  This file should not be altered in ANY fashion unless so directed by the ISC.
A word-processing field describing the definition and/or use ofeach appointment type in this file.
This file contains the cancellation reasons to be used in the SchedulingPackage.  The MAS SIUG determined the allowable reasons.  This file shouldnot be added to or have entries deleted from it.
This file contains the Wait List entries for the Wait List (Sch/PCMM) package. Each entry represents a unique wait list entry.

This file contains the list of DSS Identifiers that can be used by an institution in the Wait List (Sch/PCMM) package as a Service/Specialty. Each DSS ID is assigned an institution, date activated and date inactivated. The Service/Specialty represents a collection of clinics that have this DSS ID as the primary stop code that a patient is waiting for an appointment.

This file contains the list of Clinics that can be used by aninstitution in the Wait List (Sch/PCMM) package. The clinic must be an active clinic in the Hospital Location file. Each entry in this file will contain a wait list activation date and inactivate date.
Wait List Transmission date information - multiple
This multiple records the patient contact events.
This multiple is used as an audit trail of specific fields for VistA Scheduling GUI.

This table file contains types of outpatient classifications. These include Service Connected, Agent Orange Exposure, IonizingRadiation Exposure and Environmental Contaminants. If an entry needs to be added, modified or deleted a patch will beissued instructing the site how to make the change.  Otherwise,this table should not be edited in anyway by the site.
Enter in this field the description associated with this outpatientclassification type.
Enter in this field the effective date of the outpatientclassification type.
This file contains outpatient classifications associated with outpatientencounters.
This file contains outpatient diagnoses associated with outpatientencounters.
This file contains outpatient providers associated with outpatientencounters.

This table file contains stop codes exempted from the outpatientclassification questions. If an entry needs to be added, modified or deleted a patch will beissued instructing the site how to make the change.  Otherwise,this table should not be edited in anyway by the site.
Enter in this field the effective date of the outpatient classificationstop code exception.

This file contains a list of encounters which were selected for review based on a comparison of the ICD diagnosis codes from the encounter andthe VBA rated disabilities (VA) codes from the patient.  Entries will beedited as necessary per the review criteria established for determiningif an encounter is service-connected (SC) or non-service connected (NSC).
This multiple field tracks each edit made to this encounter through theASCD options.
Unscheduled clinic stop codes and Ambulatory Procedures stored here.

Clinic stop code is one of many codes assigned to specialties ofcare by VA Central Office for nationwide use.  For example, the stopcode number 102 is 'admissions/screening' which can be associatedwith any clinic in which the veteran will be screened for treatmentand possibly admitted.

This file provides a linkage between the scheduled appointmentidentifiers: DFN-Appointment Date/Time-Clinic IEN and the PFSS ACCOUNTFile (#375).  Indexes allow the lookup of the PFSS Account Reference byusing the appointment identifiers.

The Patient Appointment Information Transmission (PAIT) log is maintained in this file.  Log entries are added when appointment information is transmitted to the Austin Automation Center via HL7 messages.  File entries are deleted automatically when HL7 acknowledgments are received.

This file contains entries defining list attributes that areused by the Scheduling List Manager utility. The application developeradds entries in this file for each list of items to bedisplayed using the List Manager.

This table file contains entries that describe appointmentcategories/groups.  An APPOINTMENT STATUS(#409.63) file entry can beassociated with one or more of these groups This relationship is definedby the ASSOOICATED GROUPS(#100) multiple of that APPOINTMENTSTATUS file. The SDAM APPT MGT (Appointment Management) option of the Schedulingpackage uses this association. In that option, the user is allowed toselect which 'group' of appointments to view. Appointments witha current status associated with that group are then displayed. If a group needs to be added/modified/deleted, a patch will beissued instructing the site how to make the change. Otherwise,this table file should not be edited in any way by the site.

This multiple field contains column definitions forthe data displayed in the list.  Adding entries tothis multiple is optional.The column parameters are used when the List Managerwrites the line indicating the top of the list'sscrolling region.If no entries are added then only a line is writtenwith no captions.The parameters are also used by special function callsthat an application is allowed to used.  For example,there is a function at FLDUPDto update the screen. The function will change the valueof a column for a particular entry.[$$FLDUPD

This table file contains the list of valid statuses for anappointment.  If an entry needs to be added/modified/deleted, apatch will be issued instructing the site how to makethe change. Otherwise, this table file should not be editedin any way by the site.

This multiple associates this status with one or more APPOINTMENTGROUP file entries. This information is used by the 'Appointment Management'option to determine what appointments should be displayedto the user.

This table contains the query object definition for a specific database file supported by a custodial package. This definition specifies any specific mehtods and properties that are needed beyond the generic methods and properties available.  Using this query object interface, custodial packages can allow access to internal data entries to other packages without direct global access and integration agreements.
This multiple contains index definitions that are supported by the custodial package when the developer uses this query object definition.

This log file contains entries that track the execution of theappointment status update process.  An entry is added/modifiedfor each date that has been processed.  The SDAM BACKGROUND JOB andthe SDAM APPT UPDATE options create the entries. The following fields are entered at the beginning of the update process:                o  APPOINTMENT DATE                o  UPDATE METHOD (background or manual)                o  DATE LAST UPDATE STARTED                o  USER The date and time the update process completed is logged at the finishof the update process in the DATE LAST UPDATE COMPLETED field.  Ifthis field is missing at the time of OPC generation, the user will bewarned that the update process has not completed. OPC generation cancontinue, however. At the end of the OPC generation process, the OPC GENERATED DATE fieldwill be logged only if the DATE LAST UPDATE COMPLETED is present.If the OPC GENERATED DATE field is not present then OPCtransmission will not be allowed for the appointment date.

This table file contains the list of transaction types thatcan occur against an appointment.  For example, when an appointment is cancelled, the CANCEL transaction type occurs. If a transaction type needs to be added/modified/deleted, a patchwill be issued instructing the site how to make the change. Otherwise,this table file should not be edited in any way by the site.
Pointer file for grouping HOSPITAL LOCATION records for various purposes.

This file contains all outpatient encounters since 10/1/93 that have been successfully checked out or need to be checked out. The types of encounters that caused entries to be added to this file are appointments, add/edit stop codes and dispositions.  If the encounter needs to be checked out then it will have a status of 'PENDING ACTION'. The site will not receive workload credit if the status remains 'PENDING ACTION'.  'PENDING ACTION' includes both  'ACTION REQUIRED' and 'NO ACTION TAKEN' statuses.  If the encounter has been no-showed or cancelled then it will NOT be in this file.  Inpatient encounters will always have a status of 'INPATIENT APPOINTMENT'.  Appointments made for non-count clinics will always have a status of 'NON-COUNT'.  All other encounters will have a status of 'CHECKED OUT'.
The multiple field that records key elements of the patient appointmentextract.

This file will contain the current transmission status of all OutpatientEncounters and Deleted Outpatient Encounters that have been transmitted orrequire transmission to the National Patient Care Database. Entries in this file are only created when an existing entry for thespecified encounter does not exist.  When an Outpatient Encounter isdeleted, the entry in this file that pointed to that Outpatient Encounteris modified so that it points to the Deleted Outpatient Encounter that wascreated. This file does not contain the transmission history for an encounter.
This file will contain all encounters that have been deleted.

This file contains all errors that the National Patient Care Databasereported when processing an encounter. When an encounter is transmitted to the National Patient Care Database,all errors that my have occurred previous to that transmission aredeleted.

This table file contains a list of all error codes that the NationalPatient Care Database will report when processing an encounter. If an entry needs to be added, modified or deleted a patch will be issuedinstructing the site how to make the change.  Otherwise, this table shouldnot be edited in anyway by the site.
This field describes the actions necessary to correct the error.This is the text which would be viewed by a user when using the IncompleteEncounter Management Tools.
This file will contain the transmission history of all OutpatientEncounters and Deleted Outpatient Encounters that have been transmitted tothe National Patient Care Database.
This is where Versions and Builds are recorded for Clinic Scheduling.
This is where Access Groups are defined.These Groups are sometimes termed as 'department'.These are used to 'group' access types to tie together a group of Resources that may be selected from.
This is where Access Types are defined.The Resource object points to this file.This is where the Group (or department) is linked to a resource and where the colors aredefined for the calendar.
This is where Access Groups and Access Types are paired together.This is used to group Resources.

This is where a Resource object is defined for Clinical Scheduling.A Resource Object can be a NEW PERSON, HOSPITAL LOCATION, or an SDEC ADDITIONAL RESOURCE.A Resource is linked to a HOSPITAL LOCATION (or Clinic).
This is where the LETTER TEXT for a Resource is defined.
This is where the NO SHOW LETTER is defined for this Resource.
This is where the CLINIC CANCELLATION LETTER is defined for this Resource.
Additional HOSPITAL LOCATIONs (or Clinics) can be listed here for this Resource.
This is where Resources are 'grouped' with other Resources.
These are the Resources (SDEC RESOURCE)that belong to this Resource Group.
This is where a NEW PERSON user is linked to a Resource (SDEC RESOURCE).The user's ability to Overbook, Modify Schedules, and modify appointments are defined here.
This file is as used a source file for items that are to be defined as a resource, but do not fit into a typical Resource source file.SDEC RESOURCE points to this file.
This is where appointment definitions are linked to a resource.
This holds the text regarding the reason for the appointment.
This is where Patient Preferences are defined for Patients.
Multiple patient preferences are defined here for a specific patient.
This field contains additional remarks and details for this preference.
This file contains the SDEC Appt Request entries for the Appointment Scheduling application.Each entry represents a unique appointment request.
This multiple field holds the dates that are requested for multiple appointments.
These are the MRTC Appointments that have been made for this appointment request.
This multiple records the patient contact events.
This multiple is like an audit trail for specific fields and is used by VistA Scheduling GUI.

This file contains user defined parameter specification templates forthe 'ACRP Ad Hoc Report' [SCRPW AD HOC REPORT].  Because templateintegrity may be adversely affected, records in this file should not becreated or edited directly through Fileman.
This multiple stores the four types of parameters that a template alwaysconsists of (FORMAT, PERSPECTIVE, LIMITATIONS and PRINT ORDER).
This multiple contains the various elements of this parameter type.
This multiple contains the specific data items that this parameter willinclude or exclude.
This multiple contains a list of additional print field selected to beincluded in the output of detailed format reports (if any).
This is the external representation of the major category of this data type.

This file contains the parameters necessary to manipulate the various dataelements used by the 'ACRP Ad Hoc Report' [SCRPW AD HOC REPORT].          *** THE CONTENTS OF THIS FILE SHOULD NOT BE EDITED ***

This file defines which encounter forms to use for a particular clinic. Also, this file can be used to define other forms or reports to print,along with the encounter forms. The idea is that for each appointment apacket of forms can be printed, saving the effort of collating the formsmanually.first time patients, and one for all patients. Also, this file can be used to define other forms or reports to print,along with the encounter forms. The idea is that for each appointment apacket of forms can be printed, saving the effort of collating the formsmanually.
This is a list of reports or forms that should be printed under certaincircumstances. The only types of forms or reports that can be printed areones that are defined in the Package Interface file.
Used to override reports defined to print for the division. Reports defined to print for the division will not print if they areexcluded for the clinic.

This file allows the user to specify reports or forms that should print inaddition to the encounter forms for the entire division . Only reportscontained in the Package Interface file can be specified. The user canalso specify the conditions under which the report should print. Theintent is to print packets of forms that do not require manual collation.
The reports that should print.
This file contains data concerning patients scheduled for afuture admission to the medical facility.
Tracks patient one day dialysis visits

This file contains the history of changes to patient information through the pre-registration process.  Currently only the date andtime of the change, and the user making the change are maintained. This file maintains a record of changes to patient demographic informationthrough the pre-registration process and should not be purged.

This file contains a list of patients to be called as part of the Pre-Registration process. *** NOTE ***This file SHOULD NOT be edited directly.  Field values need to beentered by the background job, or the Add to Call List Option.Editing this file directly can result in erroneous data being displayedin the Call List.
This file stores a log of call attempts to patients being called for preregistration.

This file contains the statistical data necessary for each ward tocreate the daily G&L and bed status reports.  The data containedin this file is also utilized to compile a wide assortment of MASAMIS segments.
This multiple contains all census data as compiled by the G&L and BedStatus Reports.  This data is used by the inpatient AMIS reports andMUST not be altered in any way.

This is the main file in the Control Point Activity package.  It containsinformation concerning each and every control point transaction.  Thereare four basic transaction types:  Ceiling, Obligation, Adjustment andCancelled.  Each transaction type has a set of fields in this file thatrelate to it.  Some fields relate to all four transaction types.  Thisfile should only be edited through the Control Point Activity package.
These are special remarks regarding this request.
This is the item(s) being ordered on this request.
This is a description of the item being ordered.
This is a subdivision of the Control Point for thedivision of funds by section, unit ofservice, clinic or major 'product line'.
These are comments entered by Control Point personnel concerning therequest.
This is the justification for the request entered by the Control PointRequestor.
This is the reason the request was returned from fiscal.

This file keeps track of the last sequential number used for each transaction number series.  A transaction number series consists of thefollowing elements separated by hyphens:  Station Number - Fiscal Year -Control Point Number.
This file is a list of request types.  Control Point Activity users havelaygo access to this file and will populate it as they use the ControlPoint Activity package.
This field is the Delivery Schedule of the Order File, #442.8.

This file is used to build a list of repetitive (purchase request card type)items.  The Control Point Clerk can then generate requests automaticallyfrom the entries in this file.  At the time requests are generated, the itemsare pre-sorted by vendor before being entered in the Control Point Activityfile as requests.
This is the item requested in this transaction.

This file contains the names of sub-control points used by Control PointClerks and Control Point Officials to sub-divide the funds allocated tothem by Fiscal Service.  Entries in this file are established by enteringa new sub-control point name in the Sub-Control Point field of theControl Point Activity file (#410).
These are the committed balances for the control point.
This file contains the type of Control Point Activity form types.For each type of form, certain transaction data is required whencreating and editing a request.

This file contains all of the delivery schedules for itemsthat the Control Point wishes to distribute on a request.For each item of a request, they can distribute by date, quantity, Sub-Control Point and/or Delivery Point.  This filecontains all delivery schedules for each item of a request fora repetitive, non-repetitive or a non-repetitive/repetitiveform type.  If the Sub-Control Point is entered, the dollaramount of the item's cost is calculated for that Sub-Control Point and all delivery schedules' cost distribution to Sub-Control Points is totaled and the Sub-Control Point Multiple of the requestis updated with the Sub-Control Point and its associated dollar amount.If the distributed quantities and the request's transaction dollaramount matches, then entry into the Sub-Control Point Multipleis not required.  When the Control Point Official signs therequest, this delivery schedule's Sub-Control Point dollar amountdistribution updates the Sub-Control Point Balance.

This file contains the Control Point's Sort Group.  This isused as a sorting mechanism of requests to categorize theirparticular or specific cost distribution.  Each Control Pointspecifies a particular Sort Group and only sees their SortGroup. This is one of the files that is pointed-to from the Sort Groupfield of the Control Point Activity File (#410).  The other filethat the Sort Group field points to is the Engineering Work Order File.

This file contains the multiple delivery scheduleDelivery Points under the request's item multiple.This is any reference that the Control Point wishesto enter.This entry can be a room, building, location, orpoint that particular items will be delivered ordistributed by the Control Point.

This file contains a list of officially approved authorities for 1358 creation.  Entries in this file are populated via national patches only, no data should be entered, edited or deleted within this file. Per VHA Directive 2004-038, this file should not be modified.
This file contains parameters that allow each Site to tailor the IFCAPsystem to meet their needs.  Use of this file also allows the users torun multiple, independent stations on a single computer.
This is the receiving location.
This is information about the printer.
This is information about the mail invoice location.
This is the multiple to the field that contains a six digit activityaddress code for Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) code sheets.
This field is automatically populated when auser is terminated via entry in the KernelTermination field.  Users stored in this fieldcannot be entered as requestors in IFCAP.
This is a multiple to a pointer field for Authorized Fiscal Users,#411.05.  Information under this field is required when replying Yes inthe Screen for Fiscal User field.

This temporary file will be replaced by new fields on the InstitutionFile.  It is used only for printing the facility type on IFCAP generatedforms and reports (such as Purchase Orders and Receiving Reports).

This file contains information pertaining to incorrectly convertedFMS VENDOR UPDATE. This file is populated during the IFCAP vendor conversion process when a record can not be properly converted.properly converted.
THIS FILE CONTAINS A LIST OF ERROR MESSAGES.  RATHER THAN BURYING THEERROR MESSAGES IN SOME ROUTINE, THE MESSAGES ARE AVAILABLE HERE TOREVIEW OR CHANGE.
This is the text which describes the error in full.
This file will contain entries that are not site specific for IFCAP.Entries are specific to the computer that is running IFCAP.
This file will contain the non-expendable equipment requestsfor all stages of the request process.
If the requestor enters 'Y'es to change in personnel, an explanationis needed as to what kind of changes this request causes.
This field is to enter a more detailed explanation if the user answered'Y'es to any special safety considerations with equipment being requested.Goes with field JCAHO,CAP,SAFETY DEFICIENCY.
If other than 'No Change' was answered in the field CHANGE IN RECURRINGCOSTS, then a fuller explanation is needed.
If field TRAINING NEEDED? was answered 'Yes', then a detailed explanationis required to be entered.
Please explain why you think that a maintenance contract for thisequipment would be desirable.
If the CMR did not approve a request, then it is required that theyenter an explanation of why they didn't approve the request.
Briefly describe the nature and location of any necessary constructionor renovation work, whether a project is needed or not.
Describe the special tasks that Engineering Service will need toperform before the requested equipment can be installed and madeoperational.

List and describe any additional test equipment that would be neededfor calibration and/or repair of the requested NX equipment.  Do notinclude test equipment that is presently on hand or otherwise availablewithout cost.
If the PPM does not consider this to be non-expendable, an explanation ofwhy is required.
Any estimated savings that are effected by the purchase of a controlleditem needs to be identified (personnel, supplies, increased production,etc.)
Requests for additional equipment will include the number anddescription of the same or related type of machines now being usedin operation.

Requests for replacement equipment will include the complete descriptionof the item being replaced, estimate of repairs, total amount of moneyexpended for repairs while equipment was in use, and trade-in allowance.
A statement of justification for why the line item is being requestedis required.
A reason why the request was cancelled is required.
An explanation is required as to why the Equipment Committee didnot approve a request.
A reason why the Chief, Supply did not approve a equipment requestis required.
This is a item that is being entered for the request.
This field is to tell Engineering what kind of work might beneeded to install this equipment when received so they canallocate their resources.
Engineering comments of a general nature that may be of somebenefit to the Equipment Committee.
This can be other persons selected to review the request.
This file contains all turn-in requests, both those requeststhat are created because non-expendable equipment is being replacedor non-expendable equipment is no longer to be used.
This is for each item that the request for turn-in is being produced.
This CMR Official must explain why a request was not approved.
This is a full description of the line item that is being requested.
If a line item was not approved, a reason is required as to why.
This file is for designating the members of the Equipment Committeewho meet and decide on non-expendable equipment requests.
Enter the date when the Equipment Committee is going to meet to reviewrequests.
This file contains a list of users that are frequently used asconcurring officials for equipment requests.
This file contains codes that indicate that certain items may needto have special handling.
Any special comments that a concurring official might wish to enterafter reviewing a request.  May be required if they did not approvethe request and must give an explanation of why.
This file contains all of the different statuses that a equipmentrequest or turn-in request may have.
This file is used to create temporary transaction numbers for eachrequest.  The structure is SITE #-CMR #-FYR-SEQUENTIAL NUMBER.

This file retains data that is normally deleted from IFCAP files.  Thedata held in this file will be retained for a brief period of time (TBD)and purged after this retention period. It holds data that is specifically related to interface of IFCAP packageto DynaMed (an outside entity).
This multiple is used to hold details about Receiving.

In the event that an external system needs to be notified when an event of some type occurs, a publish/subscribe interface allows messages to be sent to that system when the event occurs. This file contains a list of active subscriptions, and records are added or deleted in response to "subscribe" or "cancel" messages received from the external system. More than one type of subscription is supported.

This subfile is used to store attribute values for the object associated with the subscription. Since the file is designed to work with various types of objects, attributes are stored as simple key/value pairs, where both the key and  value are free text.

This file is use to store checksums associated with objects such as file records. The reason for this level of generality is that it is at times convenient to associated a checksum with a subset of fields in a file (or possibly other objects). This means it may be necessary to support more than one checksum on the same file or other type of object class.

This file is designed to hold the various types of transactions that supportcommunication for the IFCAP and the Electronic Contract ManagementSystem (eCMS) interface.Reports from this file will be used by the IFCAP users to follow theinterface activity to assure that communication with the eCMS vendor portalis timely and effective, and to provide contact information if needed.
This multiple contains the data specific to individual transaction events.
These are various business level errors that are associated with this event.

This file contains the list of event types that describe the varioustransactions between IFCAP and the Electronic Contract Management System(eCMS). The event types describe the messages from the IFCAP perspective.
This file holds FMS reconcilliation datafor a Fiscal Service. Each entry contains thesite, control point fiscal year, quarter,transaction amount, and any FMS generateddata.

This file is used to hold 820 transmissions returnedfrom FMS for which no control point could be determined.Budget elements returned on the transmission did not matchbudget elements stored on the site's control point files.This file is used to generate the FMS Exceptions Report.

This file contains all the facility ward locations and theirrelated data, i.e., Operating Beds,  Bedsection, etc.  The wards are created/edited using the WARD DEFINITION option of the ADT module.WARD DEFINITION option of the ADT module.contains all statistical data, by date, necessary for thecomputation of the daily Bed Status report.
This multiple contains all alternate names by which this ward location isknown.  At any WARD LOCATION prompt, either the name of the ward or oneof the synonyms can be entered.
This field is a multiple and is directly related to the G&L Order field.  The information contained in this multiple is utilized on the Bed Status Report.
This field is a multiple that adds new entry without asking.

This multiple contains data on when a ward was placed out-of-service andreturned to service.  This multiple also contains information on the numberof beds that are placed out-of-service at any given time.

This multiple contains a history of the number of CO-authorized beds forthis ward broken down by date.  Each time a new number is assigned, thedate and the number of beds must be entered here.  This data is utilizedby the gains and lossed and bed status reports.
This file contains recognized PTF treating specialties. This file was previous called 'MED SPECIALTY/BEDSECTION' file.
This file contains the patients who are placed by the VA Facilityon a Waiting list and related data.
This multiple contains data about patients on a waiting list for thisdivision.  Information includes the patient's name, the type of waitinglist, and when they were entered on the waiting list.
This is a word processing fields where you may enter comments about thispatient's status on the waiting list.
This file contains the Priority Groups used when placing a patienton the Waiting List.
This multiple contains alternate names by which this priority groupingcan be referenced.  If a user enters either the name or one of thesesynonyms, this priority group will be selected.
This file contains results of Amis 334-341 reports by month for eachdivision.

The 'Segment' is the AMIS Segment number assigned to a particularreport based on VA Manual MP6, Part VI, Supp. 1.2.  In the case ofthis file, the AMIS Segment numbers are 334 through 341 series,and are for inpatient data collection activities.
This file contains results of Amis 345&346 reports by month for each division
Segment number is the number of the AMIS assigned per VA ManualMP6, Part VI, Supp. 1.2.  AMIS 345 is for NHCU statistics andAMIS 346 is for Domiciliary statistics.
Division or facility/medical center AMIS is being reported for.
This file contains Amis 358 results by month for each division.
This file contains parameters that allow the IFCAP user to define and maintain separate balances for funding at their station.
This is the name of the Fund Control Point.
This is the name of the control point user.
This is information about the cost center.
This is a description of this Control Point.
This is the official authorized to release funds.
This is the Control Point official's fund balance.
This file contains codes used by Fiscal service to subdivide funding and spending information by area of usage.
This is the budget object code for this cost center.
This is a description of the cost center (optional field).
this file contains programs used by fund control points.
This file contains FCP/PRJ used by the fund control points.
This file contains OBJECT CLASS used by the fund control points.
This file contains JOBS used by the fund control points.
This file contains REPORTING CATEGORY codes and descriptions.
This file contains REVENUE SOURCE codes and descriptions.
This file contains SUB-REV SOURCE codes and descriptions.
This file contains SUB-OBJECT codes and descriptions.
This file contains FMS SECURITY codes and descriptions.
This file contains FUNDS used by the fund control points.
This file contains SUB-ALLOWANCE ACCOUNT data used to map fund control points.
This file contains administrative office codes used by the fund control points.
This file contains document types used by the required fields table.
This file contains document data elements used by the required field table.
This file contains the required fields used by the fund control points.
This file contains the all standard dictionaries used in IFCAP.
This is used to indicate the status of an entry in file.
This file contains codes used by Fiscal service to subdivide procurement amount information by type of item used.
This is the description of this sub-account.

This file contains all ALD codes specified in MP4 Part V. In addition it contains the appropriation symbol associated with the ALD code anda pattern necessary to create the YALD code for the 921 transaction.
This file contains the names and templates for all of theCALM and LOG I Transaction Codes.
This file contains a set of codes designating standard packaging units used in both procurement and distribution of goods.
This file contains codes known as 'Reason Not Competed' which are used during the creation of a purchase order in IFCAP. These codes are used in the new FPDS report.
This file contains codes known as 'Solicitation Procedures' which are used during the creation of a purchase order in IFCAP. These codes areused in the new FPDS report.
This file contains codes known as 'Extent Competed' which are used duringthe creation of a purchase order in IFCAP. These codes are used in the newFPDS report.
This file is used by the new FPDS report and contains codes to indicate an 'Evaluated Preference' selected during the creation of a purchaseorder in IFCAP.
This file contains codes called 'EPA Designated Products' used during the creation of a purchase order in IFCAP. These codes are part of the newFPDS report.

This file contains FPDS codes for fiscal years 88 & 89.These FPDS codes are used to track the types of businesses from whichgoods are being procured, in order to do reporting to Central Office.All codes with internal entry #'s below 100 are for fiscal year 88.All codes with internal entry #'s above 100 are for fiscal year 89.
This file contains a listing of the distribution codes usedwhen entering funding transactions in the Funds Distributionportion of IFCAP.  This information may be edited.

The codes used in this file designate a broad category defining theprocurement source for goods.  The codes are used to update centralizedreporting for procurement and define either specific government sourcessuch as DEPOT and GSA, or ways of procuring goods from outside sources,such as whether or not they are purchased using a government contract.
This file is used for identifying a particular type of item for cost accounting purposes.
For use in cost distribution reports; either the RCS10-0141 or other.
This is the name of the service.
This file contains the FMS/IFCAP conversion files.
This is to store documents CONTENTS.
This is used to store comments.
This file contains information necessary to print the 850 report afterthe OOP message is processed from Austin.
This file contains codes and descriptions data used by the IFCAP.
This file contains the transaction used to distributefunds to control points.
This is a description of the transaction.
This file is used by the Funds Distribution module tomultiply distribute funds to control points.
This is the control point.
This is the description of transaction.
This file contains a history of the CALM/LOG Transactionsthat have been transmitted to Austin.  This informationis stored by Batch Number and Transaction Number.
This is the number of the batch transmission.
This file contains a listing of all the CALM Error Messagesspecified in MP4 Part V.  This file is used by Accountingto look up these messages.
This is the error message.
This file is used to "mark" a record while it is beingedited.  It serves to ensure that simultaneous editingof financial/procurement records does not occur.
This file is used to record payment invoices which requireControl Point sign-off.
Services which are required to certify invoiceas true and correct.
This is the reason for suspending payment.
This is a multiple field which contains the payment terms for this invoice.
This is a multiple field which contains a set of accounting data associatedwith the FMS accounting line.
This file is used by the Funds Distribution module to distributefunds to Control Point.
This is the transfer description.
This file is used to generate sequential tracking numbersfor Invoice Tracking.
This file will hold the printouts that are automatically generatedwithin IFCAP. The user may then select to print from this file at a laterdate/time.
This field is used to store the variables that will be used to printthe document.

This is a file of partial number counters in which each obligation hashas its own counter.  It is used to get the next available partial numberfor a payment voucher associated with a given obligation.
This file is used to construct code sheets for CALM and LOG I.
This field contains template map information.
This file is just a collection of counters.
This file contains the completed CALM/LOG Code Sheets.
This is the subaccount payroll analysis.
This is the line number of the transaction.
This is the accrual cost center line number.
This is the section B line number.
This is the receiving station or the fundcontrol point.
This is the CALM code.
This is the SF Accounting code line number.
This is the cost center line 'A' number.
This is the cost center line 'B' number.
This is the TT974 line number.
This is the line number for various multiple fieldswithin CALM.
This is the second line reference number.
This is the 941 line number.
This is the 945 line number.
This is the 946 line number.
This is a line number which cannotexceed 5 records.
This is the personal service analysis account.
This is the keypunch code.
This file contains the Reason Code used in HLS and OLStransactions.

This file contains a listing of the transactions that can be handledby the PRCOISM IFCAP server.  This file also contains the mailgroupthat will receive any transaction processing error message and theentry point (TAG

This file contains the transactions that have been received fromAustin through MailMan.  For an entry to be made in this file, thetransaction type must be found in File 423.5.  For eachcomplete transaction, based on the entry point (TAGFile 423.5, a TaskMan job is set up to process that transaction.

This file contains a list of the various CALM and LOG I BatchTypes managed by the facility.  In addition, it also containsthe appropriate physical address used by Network Mail for eachbatch type to enable the Code Sheet Batches to be transmittedto Austin DPC via VADATS.
This is the local addressee to whom thecode sheet messages are delivered.
This file contains a summary record of each authorization, obligation,and liquidation against a 1358 established in file 442.
This file contains detail history of each bill submitted for payment foreach authorization on a 1358.

This file contains the site specific parameters which are used bythe Admission, Discharge and Transfer (ADT) modules.  The parametersare set by using the 'DGPAR' routine or the 'ADT Parameters' menuoption.  The parameters are used to identify such things as yourfacility hemodialysis unit, your admission/discharge/transfer types,your divisions (if multi-division facility) and the devices to whichyou desire your 10-10's, routing slips, etc., printed to.  The ADTparameters must be set prior to running ADT.
This data is now stored in Integrated Billing.  This field to bedeleted with the next release of MAS after 5.2. Costs by treating Service charged by the VA for care received ata VA facility.
This Multiple will contain parameters used for the conversion of MASfiles from file 3, 6, and 16 to file 200.

Enter in this field the year of the means test income categorythresholds, property threshold and child income exclusion.  Thesefigures are released annually.  They are effective on January1st and are applied to the previous year income.
This field contains the dates, status, and summary information for theScheduling archive process.
Fiscal Year that inpatient and outpatient costs at a VA facilityare in effect.
A list of all routines distributed with the MAS DHCP software package.

If the USE HIGH INTENSITY ON SCREENS field has been set to YES, youmay wish to exclude it from being used on certain terminal types.If so, at this prompt you should specify the terminal type(s) whichshould not use high intensity.  This field allows you to specifymultiple terminal types.  You will be returned to it repeatedly untilno more entries are made.
This field contains a list of all entries that failed to be       converted during the Provider Conversion. The contents of thisfield will be used to generate a Mailman message at the end of the
This file contains specific outpatient and inpatient event rates which are set to specific dollar amounts which are used by the Beneficiary Travel Module.

This file contains entries which are set each year to a specific amountby MAS regulations.  The TYPEs of awards are determined by MAS VACO.This file should not be altered or added to unless so directed by theISC.
Monetary awards granted eligible veterans by the Department ofVeterans Benefits for non service connected disabilities (VAPension).
This file contains the recognized VA Admitting regulations underwhich a patient may be admitted to a VA facility.
This file contains data concerning changes, additions or deletionswhich were made to patient movement and captured by the system.The data prints on the daily G&L.

This file consists of a table of G&L type of changes.  Previously, this was a set of codes in the G&L Corrections File (#43.5).  The data in this file is distributed with the MAS package and must NOT be altered in any way.  There are currently 15 entries in this file:       1   ADMISSION ENTERED      2   ADMISSION DELETED      3   ADMISSION DATE EDITED      4   TRANSFER ENTERED      5   TRANSFER DELETED      6   TRANSFER DATE EDITED      7   DISCHARGE ENTERED      8   DISCHARGE DELETED      9   DISCHARGE DATE EDITED     10   ADMISSION WARD EDITED     11   MOVEMENT TYPE EDITED     12   TRANSFER WARD EDITED     13   FACILITY TS ENTERED     14   FACILITY TS DELETED     15   FACILITY TS DATE EDITED

This file contains those options for which a facility may specifya local template to utilize for output purposes rather than theone distributed by the MAS developers.  The file is uneditableusing VA filemanager and may not be added to under any circumstancesby the facility.  To specify a local template utilize the appropriateoption of the MAS module.

This is the main file of the Accounts Receivable system.It holds a permanent record, by bill number, of the receivable.DO NOT USE FILEMAN TO EDIT THIS FILE DIRECTLY! Using FileManwill compromise system integrity. Use the AR menu options.Per VHA Directive 10-93-142, this file definition should not be modified.
A single bill can have activity that spreads over more than onefiscal year.  This multiple field holds a record of each year'sappropriation symbol, PAT reference number, original amount, etc.
The transaction numbers in the AR Transactionfile (#433) for transactions to be includedin a 5B record to be sent to Cross-Servicing.
The dates that the Cross-Servicing recordwas received and processed.
This is a description of the bill.
This multiple field holds information about each payment receivedduring the repayment plan.
This word processing field allows the AR Clerk or Supervisor toadd optional comments at the time the bill is audited.

This file stores the categories used for billing purposes along withthe associated AMIS segment, General Ledger, ALD code and Type.DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE ! Per VHA Directive 10-93-142, this file definition should not be modified.
This is a description of the individual charges on the bill.

This file stores the type categories used to identify transactions in theTransaction File (No. 433) along with flags that are set to control theiruse. DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE ! Per VHA Directive 10-93-142, this file definition should not be modified.

This file holds the Cross-Servicing return reason codesfor the Integrated Agency Interface (IAI) file transmissionof debt/debtor reconciliation file records from FedDebt.  Per VA Directive 6402, this file should not be modified.

This file holds short text entries that are used in the debt collectionletters to identify the source of the bill. DO NOT USE FILEMAN TOEDIT THIS FILE DIRECTLY! Using FileMan will compromise system integrity.Use the AR menu options. Per VHA Directive 10-93-142, this file definition should not be modified.

This file serves as a temporary storage file for archived AR Records.Entries in this file are populated by the AR Archive Module. FileManshould not be used directly to add/edit to this file. Per VHA Directive 10-93-142, this file definition should not be modified.
The data record for the archived entry.  The data items are formattedby Record Label:field value.

This file holds the Accounts Receivable transactions and all relatedinformation.  DO NOT USE FILEMAN TO EDIT THIS FILE DIRECTLY!Using Fileman will compromise system integrity. Use the AR menu options. Per VHA Directive 10-93-142, this file definition should not be modified.
This is an optional comments field for this transaction.
This is a description of the individual charges.

FileName: AR MEDICARE DEDUCTIBLE ALERTS PART A
Description: This file is used to store Medicare Part A Deductible Alerts (MDA) thatare received by the Financial Services Center (FSC) in Austin and sent tothe individual sites.  This data will be used by the new MDA worklist sothat Accounts Receivable personnel can take any necessary action.
This multiple contains comments pertaining to the Medicare DeductibleAlert received from the Financial Services Center, FSC.
This field is for any comments that the user chooses to enter for this alert.
Contains locations found in the hospital (ie. Wards, Clinics) *********DO NOT RE-INDEX THIS FILE**********

This field contains the patterns and limit dates applicable to schedulingappointments on Saturdays.  These fields are overridden by patterns enteredfor a specific (Saturday) date and stored on the "OST" nodes.
Special pattern information (storage of previous clinic patternsand current one).
Appointment multiple stores all data related to outpatient visitsincluding basic demographic data on a patient, appointment data,lab, x-ray and EKG appointment dates/times.
Multiple that stores clinic availability information.
Patient for whom this data relates.
Time slots or pattern scheduled for a specific clinic.
Pattern for clinic availability information.
Does user want the chart checked for availability for this clinic.
Patient associated with appointment data.

This field contains the patterns and limit dates applicable to schedulingappointments on Thursdays.  These fields are overridden by patterns enteredfor a specific (Thursday) date and stored on the "OST" nodes.

This field contains the patterns and limit dates applicable to schedulingappointments on Fridays.  These fields are overridden by patterns enteredfor a specific (Friday) date and stored on the "OST" nodes.
Synonym or shortened name associated with a specific location.
Terminals that cannot be utilized from specific location.
Special instructions (free text) entered by clerk at time of makingthe appointment.

Privileged users set up to have access to book to clinic.Once one privileged user is entered into this multiple, no otheruser will have access to book to the clinic.  Each individual whoshould have access to clinic must be entered one at a time.
Cancellation date/time beginning for a clinic.

This field contains the patterns and limit dates applicable to schedulingappointments on Sundays.  These fields are overridden by patterns enteredfor a specific (Sunday) date and stored on the "OST" nodes.

This field contains the patterns and limit dates applicable to schedulingappointments on Mondays.  These fields are overridden by patterns enteredfor a specific (Monday) date and stored on the "OST" nodes.

This field contains the patterns and limit dates applicable to schedulingappointments on Tuesdays.  These fields are overridden by patterns enteredfor a specific (Tuesday) date and stored on the "OST" nodes.

This field contains the patterns and limit dates applicable to schedulingappointments on Wednesdays.  These fields are overridden by patterns enteredfor a specific (Wednesday) date and stored on the "OST" nodes.

Enter in this field the providers associated with this clinic.  Theseproviders will then be displayed when updating the provider throughAppointment Management or Check Out to assist the user in enteringthe correct provider.

Enter in this field the diagnoses associated with this clinic.  Thesediagnoses will then be displayed when updating the diagnosis throughAppointment Management or Check Out to assist the user in enteringthe correct diagnosis.
This file contains executable 'M' code for Scheduling Data field extracts.
This contains one or more team positions that have this clinic asan 'ASSOCIATE CLINIC' - defined in the TEAM POSITION (#404.57) File.
This file contains the listing of Vendors used by the facility. The dataincludes the name, address, contact person, contract number and FPDS dataused when entering a request and purchase order.
This is the type of ownership for FY88 FPDS reporting purposes.
This is a synonym for the vendor.
This is the Vendor's Contract # or Basic Ordering Agreement(BOA) #.
These are remarks about the vendor.
This is the socioeconomic group of the vendor for thecurrent year.
This file contains the name and address of those patients whoreceived deliveries of goods directly from a vendor.  This addresscould be a Nursing Home Care address or another vendor address.
This file contains the listing of Vendors used by the facility. The dataincludes the name, address, contact person, contract number and FPDS dataused when entering a request and purchase order.
This is the type of ownership for FY88 FPDS reporting purposes.
This is a synonym for the vendor.
This is the vendor contract number.
These are remarks about the vendor.
This is the socioeconomic group of the vendor for thecurrent year.
This is a charge card master file.
This is the user who can also use this purchase card to order items.
This file is used to store ORACLE records for reconciliation.

During the compile performed in option Accrual (Monthly) [PRCB MONTHLYACCRUAL], entries are added to this file listing total unpaid andunreconciled credit card order amounts by budget string "Fund/BeginningBudget Fiscal Year/ Administration or Staff Office/AccountingClassification Code/Cost Center/BOC" within month and station. Thisfile then serves as the source for generating the appropriate SVdocuments to be sent to FMS.
This is the doc line multiple.

This file contains a record of each transmission batch from the CreditCard System of Purchase Card Charges and Purchase Card Demographic Changesto be posted to IFCAP files (#440.6 and #440.5, respectively).  This fileis the source for the report Daily Charge Transmission Log [PRCH DAILYCHARGE TRANS LOG].

This file contains descriptive information for any supply item that can beordered.  Contains information needed for purchasing or ordering the item.Any item that is purchased repetitively should be entered to this file.
This is the vendor for the item.
This is the description of the item.
This is the fund control point.
This is a purchase order that uses this item.

This field stores the value of the DESCRIPTION field (#.1) prior to theoverwriting of that field's value with the value from the National ItemFile (NIF) database.  This field MUST NOT be edited.  It is for historicalrecord only.

This file contains codes used to classify types of items into categoriesto be used for centralized reporting of procurement.  Examples of categoriesare 'DRUGS & BIOLOGICALS', 'SURG. DRESS. MATERIALS', etc.  This file also contains new entries known as product service codeswhich are applicable to services only. These codes are not allowed to be used with items.
This is a description of the classification.

This file contains codes used to classify types of items into categoriesto be used for centralized reporting of procurement.  The categories arebroader than those on the "FEDERAL SUPPLY CLASSIFICATION" file.  Examplesare "CHEMICALS" and "SUBSISTENCE". Also this file has been updated with product service codes (PSC) tosupport a new report requirement for the Austin Automation Center (AAC).

A general purpose file containing assorted DLA and LOG codes used whenconstructing electronic transmissions to either the Austin LOG system,or the DLA system.  The 'SCREENING CODE' field is used to limit thechoice of codes available to the user to an appropriate set.
This is the long description of the DLA code fromthe transmission.  It should describe the use of the code.

This file contains a list of the allowable types of amendments thatcan be made to a Requisition after it has been Obligated. The file is usedduring the Amendment process, both to allow the user to select the type ofamendment, and to direct the programs to the proper entry point forprocessing the type of amendment selected.
This file contains the delivery locations and dates for displayon purchase orders.

This is the main file for IFCAP Supply. It contains all of the PurchaseOrder and Requisition data both while the record is being processed,and as an online history record after the record has been completed.It also contains information pertaining to Accounts Receivable transactions.
This is the name of the item on this purchase request.
These are the dates for delivery for delivery locations.
This is the remarks field.
This is the discount for this order.
These are comments about this purchase order.

This multiple will hold the  dollar amount for each BOCwithin this file 442 record.   Longer explanation.  The BOC field in this multiple allows theselection of one of the ITEM multiple BOC.  Only the BOClisted in the "D" x-ref found within the ITEM multiple in thisrecord, are allowable choices for the BOC multiple.
This is a description of the item.
Theses are the prompt payment terms.
This is an amendment to the purchase order.
This is the date the item was received.
This is the funds obligation data.
This is the amount of the purchase order/partial.
This is the information used for a partial order.
This is the purchase method.
This is a description of the amendment.
This is the reference number for this request for this station.
Theses are the administrative certifications for thispurchase order.
